010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * This class represents a 2D scaling transformation (as a special case of 
016 * affine transformation).
017 */
018public class Scaling2D extends AffineMapping2D {
019        
020        public Scaling2D(Scaling2D sc) {
021                super(sc);
022        }
023
024        /**
025         * Constructor.
026         * Creates a mapping that scales along the x- and y-axis
027         * by the associated factors.
028         * 
029         * @param sx the scale factor in x-direction
030         * @param sy the scale factor in y-direction
031         */
032        public Scaling2D(double sx, double sy) {
033                super(
034                        checkZero(sx), 0,  0,
035                        0,  checkZero(sy), 0);
036        }
037        
038        private static double checkZero(double s) {
039                if (Arithmetic.isZero(s)) {
040                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("zero scale parameter " + s);
041                }
042                return s;
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Constructor. Creates a uniform scaling in x and y.
047         * @param s the common scale factor
048         */
049        public Scaling2D(double s) {
050                this(s, s);
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * {@inheritDoc}
055         * @return a new scaling transformation
056         */
057        @Override
058        public Scaling2D getInverse() {
059                return new Scaling2D(1/a00, 1/a11);
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * {@inheritDoc}
064         * @return a new scaling transformation
065         */
066        @Override
067        public Scaling2D duplicate() {
068                return new Scaling2D(this);
069        }
070}
